game_description: Please, Donâ€™t Touch Anything is a cryptic, brain-racking button-pushing puzzle game. Covering for a colleague taking a bathroom break, you find yourself in front of a mysterious console with a green screen monitor showing a pixelated live image of an unknown city. Also present is an ominous red button with the simple instruction to not touch anything! Push the red button once or press it many times. Your choices and actions will lead to outrageous and frightening consequences and over 30 unique puzzle endings. Scavenge the room for clues, tools, and buttons to solve riddles and trigger explosive events. This deceptively simple console has many mind-blowing surprises for you. This updated version of the classic game features all new high-quality visuals, new mechanics, updated classic endings with new solutions, and a slew of new endings. Go ahead, press the button. You know you want to.
Languages: English, Chinese (China), Chinese (Hong Kong), Dutch, French (France), German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Polish, Portuguese (Brazil), Portuguese (Portugal), Russian, Spanish (Spain), Turkish
review_1: Please donâ€™t touch anything is an amazing puzzle game worth the 10 bucks So the main game is your stuck in a office when your friend is going to the bathroom, the puzzles are great and not half baked and theyâ€™re really good and you will be teleporting around the room constantly going from one thing to the next with a book or a code in one hand and a phone in another 10/10 on the puzzles and that brings me to the endings ,the endings are fun and sometimes Humorous but the â€œhorrorâ€ tag that the game has ,might drive some away but most of the endings are not horror and fun like a big robot trashing a city Great exempt for 1 thing the stars of David and satanic imagery is present but isnâ€™t much Over all great game would recommend, thanks for your time
review_2: (first paragraph is my thoughts 2nd is the review 3rd is what you could add) I LOVE puzzles and mysteries but ones that are kinda easy to solve but still take a while, I used to play I Expected you to die 2 but I NEVER beat it. This has nice puzzles, ones where your left wondering â€œWhatâ€™s Next?â€. This game is for people who are new with VR or need a cheap good game! Even if it was 60$ I would still buy it so 10/10 Maybe add a built in guide/hint system where you have hints while loading or in the pause menu. You could have it as a setting in settings, like Hints On/Off (if you add this plz credit me)
review_3: Crash Course: Friend goes to the bathroom and tells you not to touch anything obviously you do multiple puzzles leading to different endings around 30 total. Puzzles are unique and have memory based things so write stuff down! This has both a standing and sitting mode and height adjustment in the SETTINGS. (This is in full 3D not the 2D Console/PC version similar but different.) ____________________________________________________________ What I recommend: Writing Paper/Utensil for remembering codes and hints Go in blind personally I watched a lot of videos about the game but going in blind is more exciting. Motion sickness may occur so be prepared for a lack of floor and moving backgrounds. Motion sickness in some endings due to moving floor and lack of floor/legs. ___________________________________________________________ Some minor cons: Controls can be finicky but aren't that bad. Stars of David/2 Satanic and 666 endings but very little gameplay of those things. Horror is very minor but is still there to be prepared for flashing lights and unexpected jump scares. If you have a bad memory you may need to write some things down which takes away from gameplay.
review_4: This is one of my favorite games on my VR headset. The puzzles are good and and the game is funny too. The only reason it's not 5 stars is because the puzzles can sometimes be too hard. If you don't know something in this game that is required to beat a puzzle then you have to research or look it up online. Other than that this game is really good.
